data.title: How to Watch the 2024 Paris Olympics in Taiwan
data.meta_description: Excited about the 2024 Paris Olympics? If you're in Taiwan, here's how to catch all the action. First, check local broadcasters like TTV or CTS for live
data.text:
Excited about the 2024 Paris Olympics? If you’re in Taiwan, here’s how to catch all the action. First, check local broadcasters like TTV or CTS for live coverage.

Prefer online streaming? Platforms like BBC iPlayer and Peacock TV are the best options. Don’t miss out on your favorite events by setting reminders for key competitions.

Learn How to Watch the 2024 Paris Olympics in Taiwan.

Quick steps to Watch 2024 Paris Olympics in Taiwan

For a complete Paris olympics event coverage, consider using PureVPN app to access streaming services like BBC iPlayer in the UK, 9Now in Australia, Peacock TV in the USA, and CBC Gem in Canada.

Subscribe to PureVPN app

Install the app on your device.

Connect to a prefered server, where your favorite sports event ongoing.

Open the website or app.

Enjoy watching 2024 Summer Olympics live in Taiwan.

Why Do You Need a VPN to Watch The Paris Summer Olympics?

Even though your local streaming service might cover the event, it might only show a limited selection. The rest of the events might be available on other platforms. Therefore, there’s a high chance you could miss your favorite sport if that streaming service isn’t available in your country.

Solution? You need a workaround that masks your IP address and changes it to where the events streaming is available. This is why you need a VPN service like PureVPN. It switches your virtual location to the desired country, making you appear as a native of that country, and lets you enjoy the entire match no matter where you are in the world. Enjoy streaming!

Taiwan at 2024 Summer Olympics – Everything you need to know

Olympic Identity: Taiwan, officially known as Chinese Taipei at the Olympics, will compete in the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris from July 26 to August 11, 2024.

Competitors: Taiwan will send 60 athletes to compete in 16 sports.

Sport Disciplines: Taiwanese athletes will compete in archery, badminton, boxing, canoeing, cycling, gymnastics, judo, sailing, shooting, surfing, table tennis, taekwondo, and weightlifting.

Notable Athletes:

Kuo Hsing-chun, a weightlifter and gold medalist from Tokyo 2020, holding multiple world records.

Tai Tzu-ying, a top-ranked badminton player aiming for her first Olympic gold medal.

Yang Yung-wei, Taiwan’s first Olympic medalist in judo.

Chou Tien-chen, a badminton player who has overcome health challenges.

Sun Chen, a breakdancer competing in the new breakdancing event.

Historical Context: Taiwan competes as “Chinese Taipei” due to a political agreement with the IOC, reflecting the complex relationship between Taiwan and China.

Summer Olympics Live on BBC iPlayer

You can watch the 2024 Summer Olympics live on BBC iPlayer. BBC One and BBC Two will broadcast over 250 hours of live coverage, including athletics, swimming, gymnastics, and more. Plus, BBC iPlayer offers an “Olympics Extra” stream for additional live events and highlights.

BBC iPlayer is only accessible in the UK, so to access it from somewhere else, you’ll need PureVPN and connect it to a UK server. Then, you can watch the Summer Olympics 2024 live.

2024 Summer Olympics Live on Peacock TV

Fans can watch the action of the 2024 Summer Olympics on Peacock TV. With the most comprehensive coverage ever, Peacock offers live streaming of every Olympic event, including all 329 medal events. Additionally, Peacock features full-event replays, NBC programming, curated clips, virtual channels, and exclusive original content, making it your go-to platform for the Olympics.

2024 Summer Olympics Live on CBC Gem

You can watch the 2024 Summer Olympics live exclusively on CBC Gem. CBC has secured the broadcast rights and will offer extensive live coverage across its platforms, including the free CBC Gem streaming service. Whether you’re using a TV, phone, tablet, or computer, the CBC Gem app ensures you can enjoy the Olympics anywhere.

FAQ(s)

What is the official name under which Taiwan competes at the Olympics?

Taiwan competes under the name “Chinese Taipei” due to a long-standing agreement with the International Olympic Committee (IOC) that reflects the political sensitivities surrounding the island’s status.

How many athletes will Taiwan send to the 2024 Summer Olympics?

Taiwan is expected to send a delegation of approximately 60 athletes to compete in 16 different sports at the Paris 2024 Olympics.
